original_title: Honeywell gets contract to repair APUs at SriLankan Airlines
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Sri Lanka's Cabinet of Minister granted approval to award the contract for repairing Honeywell Additional Power Units (APUs) of the SriLankan Airlines to Honeywell International SARL.
The company submitted the minimum price quotation for an estimated sum of US dollars 15.3 million for a period of 02 years.

The Department of Government Information said that bids were called through a limited international competitive bid calling methodology for repairing the Honeywell Additional Power Units (APUs) of Sri Lankan Airlines, and consequently, three bids were received.
